modal_alert1.message: Task has been published, cannot modify the question order

modal_alert2.message: All questions have been sorted by type, no need to organize

modal_alert3.message: Are you sure you want to organize all questions by type

question_score_type.info:
You can set the scoring mode for multiple-choice questions and ordering questions in the test paper:
Loose scoring mode: ① Multiple-choice questions will be scored based on the number of correct options selected. If a wrong option is selected, zero points will be awarded.
② Ordering questions are scored based on the number of correct orders, and the score of each item is averaged based on the total score of the question and the number of orders.
Strict scoring mode: Only answers with all options correct or order correct will be scored, any incorrect options or orders will result in zero points for the question.

grade_type.label12:
The total score of this volume is {{total_score}} points, and the system will correspond to the score ratio and rating set here
Please note that the correspondence set here applies to the whole volume and all questions, and the different score settings of the questions can reflect their different weights in the whole volume

modal_alert.title: Tips
modal_alert.message1: The content of this homework/exercise has changed after publication. It needs to be updated after publication to take effect immediately for students. If the answer or score of the objective question is modified, it will also trigger a re-automatic marking after the update is published. Do you want to update it now?
modal_alert.message2: Tip: Detected that the question score has been modified, for manually graded questions, you need to re-review the score to adapt to the new score setting.

subject_comp.changed: The question has been modified and needs to be updated to take effect

attach.info: Each respondent can upload up to 9 files, with a maximum limit of 200M per file

modal_alert1.title: Tip
modal_alert1.message: Are you sure to delete the current question?

modal_alert2.title: Tip
modal_alert2.message: The mobile terminal does not support editing this type of question. If you need to edit, please visit Xiaoya on your computer

item.title: Blank {{index}} Answer
item.toast_t: You need to enable [Multiple Answers Supported], for specific instructions, please refer to the prompt information after [Multiple Answers Supported]
item.toast_f: You need to disable [Multiple Answers Supported], after disabling, grading will be based on the inputted answer. If the correct answer contains a semicolon, please use this mode.
item.placeholder_f: Please enter the correct answer here

multi_answer.title: Multiple Answers Supported
multi_answer.toast: After enabling [Multiple Answers Supported], each blank item can set multiple answers, separated by ";", such as: Answer One ; Answer Two. During automatic grading, the blank item will match the corresponding multiple answers. For example, the answer to blank 1 has set three items, which are "Wuhan", "Wuhan City", and "Jiangcheng". When the student answers the question, as long as the written answer is any of the three, it will be judged as correct.

a.title: Answer Completely Matches
a.toast: The student's answer and the correct answer set are exactly the same to be correct, such as: Correct Answer: Wuhan City Student's Answer: Wuhan During automatic grading, this situation is considered as answering incorrectly.

b.title: Answer Partially Matches
b.toast: The correct answer contains the student's answer, so it is considered correct, such as: Correct Answer: Wuhan City Student's Answer: Hubei Wuhan City During automatic grading, this situation is considered as answering correctly.

c.title: Answer Matches in Order
c.toast: The student's answer and the correct answer set are in the same order to be correct, such as: Blank 1 Answer: The river falls three thousand feet Blank 2 Answer: It seems the Milky Way falls for nine days Student's Answer 1: It seems the Milky Way falls for nine days Student's Answer 2: The river falls three thousand feet During automatic grading, this situation is considered as answering incorrectly.

d.title: Answer Matches Out of Order
d.toast: The student's answer and the correct answer set do not need to correspond in order, such as: Blank 1 Answer: Beijing Blank 2 Answer: Tianjin Student's Answer 1: Tianjin Student's Answer 2: Beijing During automatic grading, this situation is considered as answering correctly.
